result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick D Skemp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court grants 41 days credit if revoked.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Per C-31. $2500.00 cash bond to be applied.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must maintain absolute sobriety. No firearms of any kind. May not consume alcohol and may not be on any premises where alcohol is served for consumption which includes bars, taverns and beer tents.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent including a mental health evaluation.  Must continue mental health counseling with Aurora or another facility. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
The pistol taken into evidence is ordered forfeited. Other long guns shall be turn over to Kendra L.

Patrick Skemp addresses the court.
Court relates and orders:

10 years Imposed and Stayed prison sentence with 5 years initial incarceration and 5 years extended supervision.
Dodge reception center.

5 years probation.

May not consume alcohol and may not be on any premises where alcohol is served for consumption includes bars, taverns and beer tents.  Clerk - do not use bar standardized text.

Must continue mental health counseling with Aurora or other facility. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent including mental health evaluation.
$6,801.12 restitution with $2,500.00 cash bond to be applied.
No jail time.

Entitled to 41 days jail credit in the event probation is revoked.
Pistol taken in to evidence ordered forfeited.  
Other long guns shall be turned over to Kendra L.
